body:
Hi guys,



I'm going through Chris Mackey's Youtube tutorials and there seem to be a couple of missing components since then...for instance, what happened to the Honeybee_zoneAttributeList?



Cheers,

Max

replies.body: Hi Abraham, I'm probably missing something obvious here but I can't find it: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Opa8q*Ld3jtFVq4kESl4cThIPN3FhGY6iP-kF4Y62FoiBqrTSt2y6n8IS767J4u0p3jNbk0bfcazPrTlaI-onpSbXpbf7n1y/interface.png)

You have a faulty installation. Just download the latest from github and drop the contents into the user library folder.

-A.

I think I know the issue and you probably don't have to reinstall Ladybug.  Just restart Rhino/Grasshopper.

When you update userObjects using the "Update Honeybee" component, Grasshopper does not always read all of the updated components and you have to restart it.

Hi Chris and Abraham,

It's weird, I just downloaded the user objects again and pasted them into the user objects folder. There had been some missing and now they are there and everything is working.

I could have sworn that the other day when I downloaded Honeybee from food4rhino the SolveAdjacencies user object (among others) wasn't in the zip, but I just downloaded and checked it again and all components are there...

Anyway, thanks for your help!

One component I still can't find though is the Optimal Shade Creator...posted that here [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/forum/topics/what-happened-to-the-hone...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/forum/topics/what-happened-to-the-honeybee-optimal-shade-creator)

Max,

The "Optimal Shade Creator" had a name change when I realized that it was useful for so many different situations.  It's now called the "Mesh Threshold Selector" and it's under the Ladybug 5|Extra tab."

[https://mostapharoudsari.gitbooks.io/ladybug-primer/content/text/co...](https://mostapharoudsari.gitbooks.io/ladybug-primer/content/text/components/Mesh_Threshold_Selector.html)

-Chris
